item.title: Atomic Heart DLC ‘Enchantment Under the Sea’ launches January 28, 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/atomic-heart-dlc-enchantment-under-the-sea-launches-january-28-2025

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Search for answers in the depths of the 3826 Facility.

Atomic Heart downloadable content “Enchantment Under the Sea” will launch on January 28, 2025, publisher Focus Entertainment and developer Mundfish announced.

Here is an overview of the downloadable content, via Mundfish:

Look for Answers in the Depths of Facility 3826

“Enchantment Under the Sea” goes back to the spectacular combat gameplay that made Atomic Heart one of the highlights of 2023, as players continue the main storyline with the Twins’ consciousness at their side and new weapons in their arsenal.

Meet new and returning characters while diving into the mysteries of the underwater Neptune Research Center to find a way to save humanity from a dismal future. Players will also revisit familiar locations from Facility 3826 that have changed beyond recognition, like the flying city of Chelomey, now under the robots’ total control.

New Weapons and Glove Abilities to Dismantle New Threats and Bosses

With new challenges comes the need for new tricks! In addition to the expanded storyline, season pass owners get two new weapons: the Thunderclap, a powerful hammer that amps up damage with electrical current, and the KM-4 Kuzmich, a crowd-clearing double-barrel shotgun with customizable bullet spread. They’re complemented by two new glove abilities courtesy of the Twins: Blaze, a burning polymer skill letting players drop red-hot fireballs and deal area-of-effect damage; and Whip, a grapple-hook tool allowing P-3 to pull himself towards enemies, deal damage, dodge away from danger, and access previously unreachable areas.

These new powers will come in handy when meeting the downloadable content’s new roster of sea-dwelling enemies, from swarms of coral mutants to the terrifying MOR-4Y.

Atomic Heart is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam.

item.title: LEGO Fortnite Brick Life announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/lego-fortnite-brick-life-announced

LEGO Fortnite will add a new “social role-playing experience” called LEGO Fortnite Brick Life on December 12, Epic Games announced.

The base LEGO Fortnite game will also be renamed to LEGO Fortnite Odyssey, coinciding with the “Storm Chasers” update due out on December 10. The update will also add a new biome, dungeons, enemies, items, and boss.

Here is an overview of LEGO Fortnite Brick Life, via Epic Games:

Make new friends, explore the sights, land your dream job, and move into your new home in LEGO Fortnite Brick Life! It’s an all-new social role-play experience in the LEGO Fortnite universe, launching on December 12!

Wondering where you need to go to start your city life? When you head into Discover, you’ll now find LEGO Fortnite listed as its own unique category within Fortnite.

There, you’ll find LEGO Fortnite Brick Life, as well as LEGO Fortnite Odyssey (the original LEGO Fortnite experience, now with all-new features, characters, an electrifying villain, and a new name!) and any creator-made or LEGO Group LEGO Islands. Simply select “LEGO Fortnite Brick Life” to start building your new city lifestyle!
